snippet: The Obama administration proposed a compromise that it said would guarantee free coverage of birth control while allowing churches and religious organizations not to pay for it.
abstract: Obama administration proposes compromise that would guarantee free coverage of birth control under the Affordable Care Act while allowing churches and religious organizations to opt out of paying for it; proposal, the third in the last 15 months, does not bring an end to political furor or legal wrangling over the issue, as religious groups remain dissatisfied and call for a broader, more explicit exemption for religious organizations and others with similar objections to contraceptive coverage.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration proposed a compromise that it said would guarantee free coverage of birth control while allowing churches and religious organizations not to pay for it.

headline.main: Birth Control Rule Altered to Allay Religious Objections
headline.print_headline: Compromise Idea For the Insuring Of Birth Control

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
